example[0]: the proprietor of a small hotel and restaurant
example[1]: Echenard was the proprietor of the famous Hotel du Louvre.
example[2]: Horace Greeley was a powerful newspaper proprietor.
definition[2]: someone who owns land or buildings
definition[3]: someone who owns a legal right such as a PATENT or a COPYRIGHT (=rights to be the only maker, producer, or seller of something for a specific period of time)
example[3]: The proprietor of a trademark has the exclusive right to use the mark in relation to the class of goods or services against which it is registered.
